subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Grouping/Partitioning
msgSnippet: ... That last bit probably sounded more negative than you intended it to, so I won t take it negatively or personally. Likewise, I don t know how to say this
messageBody:
Bradley, Todd wrote:

> > Yep; that's a difference all right. I can't imagine having a
> > test suite that takes 10 hours to run.
>
> I'm surprised you don't have a more active imagination! :-)
>
> On the project I'm on, we now have so many JUnit-based tests that we
> have to schedule them to run on alternating nights on two different test
> servers. It takes about 14 hours to run through them all. But we're
> using JUnit as a foundation for an automated system testing framework,
> and I suspect your imagination is limited to JUnit being a unit test
> tool.

That last bit probably sounded more negative than you intended it to, so
I won't take it negatively or personally.

Likewise, I don't know how to say this without sounding like an ass, so
please bear with me: are /all/ those 14 hours worth of tests really that
valuable? More valuable than faster tests that would cover the same
area? It just seems to me that, at 14 hours, I wouldn't be happy with
the speed with which I obtained feedback.

Of course, I'm not in your shoes, so I don't know the whole picture.

Take care.
